learning_outcomes.description: Identify a problem suitable for research and pose a research question.
Demonstrate knowledge of how to systematically research the scientific literature in your topic area.
Critique and synthesize the literature throughout the review.
Provide a written literature review of a quality that is commensurate with a publication in a relevant academic journal.

assessments.task_description:
The aim of this assessment item is for students to demonstrate the process of developing a researchable question for the purposes of a structured literature review. The PICO(T), SPIDER or other approved framework must be used to scaffold the question. The planned research question should be presented with justification for the proposed population group (with inclusion and exclusion criteria); intervention or phenomenon of interest being investigated; and proposed search strategy detailed. A summary of proposed literature sources (including databases) is also desirable.

Students are advised to refer to the assessment task sheet located on the NUMW6001 Blackboard site for additional details.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are required to submit their work via Turnitin as a word document only. Documents submitted in any other format (e.g. PDF) will not be accepted and student will be asked to resubmit and may incur a late penalty as a result. Please check the course Blackboard assessment area for specific instructions on this process. A link will be made available in the assessment area of your Blackboard course to allow you to submit your assignment electronically.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This task requires students to conduct a literature review relevant to their chosen research topic, and which address the research question posed in task one. The review is intended to provide a thorough background to the future research project and will help identify the gap in current knowledge that will be addressed by your research project.

Student are advised to refer to the assessment task sheet located on the NUMW6001 Blackboard site for additional details.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Exam week 2(23 Feb - 21 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Supervisor Meetings

Students are to arrange regular meeting with supervisory team regarding roles and responsibilities. Set clear meeting times and agenda items and plan of work for the semester. Students are encouraged to set meeting adgenda and develop written summaries of what was agreed upon actions for each of the meetings.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
